page.title: 06Health
page.content: On investigation there seems very little illness in the valley, and few accidents on the narrow lanes. There are no main water pipes in the area but springs and wells, man made tarns and fast flowing revers provide enough. Many homes have private wells. Again no main sewer, but sceptic tanks and cess pits which are regularly inspected by the local council. None in the area but several on the perimeter, good general hospitals in easy reach, an excellent ambulance service and health centres at Bowness and Kendal. Midwives and district nurses visit anyone needing them, and home helps.
